chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Great Bodily Harm)

result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred judgment agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed. The defendant has not been convicted of the dismissed charges.

The defendant Jennifer Shepard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 2 days only if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 25 searches/month and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant may not have any contact with the co-defendant (Brandon Brunette).

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any bar, tavern, or class B establishment that serves alcohol - including beer tents.

The defendant must participate and successfully complete a parenting class with follow thru.

The defendant must submit a DNA sample with surcharge assessed.

timeConds.notes: Stay 120 days - serve 60 days. Huber and good time allowed.

Defendant Jennifer  Shepard in court with attorney Greg A Petit - appears telephonically with leave of court.  Defendant Jennifer  Shepard in custody.  MIchael Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin via telephone with leave of the court. Petit states why we are here today, received a call from Clerk Carter informing that a bond needs to be set. Petit - agreed with counsel to modify bond to $5000.00 signature bond with same conditions, refund remaning bond. State agrees. Court grants motion, sets bond at $5000.00 signature with same conditions, refund bond posted, adjourned at 9:19 AM.
Bail/bond hearing at 11-03-2015 09:15 am
#1 - DVD (stored in small exhibit box in vault); #2 - series of pictures after injury; #3 - series of pictures prior to injury.

Defendant Jennifer  Shepard in court with attorney Greg A Petit.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:34 PM. Clerk has marked exhibits #1, #2 and #3 prior to court being called. Petit - defendant's father would like to make a statement. Court allows Anthony Shepard to make statement. Shepard sits in witness stand to make statement. (2:36 PM). Shepard stepped down at 2:36 PM. State will be calling some witnesses and wants to present a DVD - marked as exhibit #1 - played on laptop for Judge Kussel to review on video. All parties surround the video at 2:37 PM. Court reporter does not need to transcribe the video. State offers exhibit #1 (DVD). Court receives after no objections (2:41 PM.) State offers exhibits #2 and #3 - series of photos of victim. Court receives after no objections (2:42 PM). State calls Chris Slagowski. Slagowski makes statement from witness stand (2:43 PM). Slagowski stepped down at 2:48 PM. State calls Christine Ouellette. Christine Ouellette makes statement from witness stand (2:49 PM). Oullette stepped down at 3:00 PM. No more witnesses on either side. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - of a withheld sentence on all counts, 2 years probation with 120 days jail - staying 90 and serve 30 days in jail with conditions, approve deferred entry of judgment on count #2 for 2 years with attached appendix that sets forth conditions - remand today. Petit makes final argument prior to sentencing - asking Court to follow joint recommendation - asks for time to report Shepard has attorney make statement as she is too emotional. Statement read by counsel. Court sentences the defendant to the following: on counts #1, #3 and #4 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: impose 180 days in FC jail - 60 days in FC jail and stay 120 days - huber and good time allowed - credit for 2 days only if revoked - report today, costs on each count - take bond posted, maintain absolute sobriety, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bar, tavern or class B establishments (including beer tents), no contact with co-defendant (Brandon Brunette), particpate and successfully complete parenting class with follow thru (25 searches/month), maintain/obtain full time employment/school, other conditions as deemed appropriate by P&P along with standard P&P conditions; count #2 - accept deferred entry of judgment agreement for 2 years with its attached conditions, restitution of $325.46 plus 10% surcharge - take bond posted, DNA surcharge of $200.00 - take bond posted, right to apeal, adjourned.
Letter from Attorney Petit to Judge Kussel
Deferred Entry of Judgment
Sentencing hearing at 10-20-2015 02:00 pm

Defendant Jennifer  Shepard in court with attorney Greg A Petit.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:50 AM. State - here for change of plea today. Petit agrees. State has filed an Amended Information. Petit has Amended Information and waives reading of it, agreements/offers have been made to waive reading of it- deferred agreement on count #2 - and place on probation on other counts for 2 years with conditions of 120 days in FC jail - staying 90 and imposing 30, no consumption of alcohol or controlled drugs, no entry into any taverns, bars or premises where the main income is from the sell of alcohol, no contact with the co-defendant, participate in parenting classes, employment/school, any other conditions as determined by P&P. Petit provides Court with plea questionnaire. Court - defendant will be plead NC to counts  - NC to count #1, #2, #3 and #4 as alleged on Amended Information that was filed today. Shepard pleads NC to counts #1, #2, #3 and #4 as alleged on Amended Information. Court goes thru plea questionnaire, finds the defendant has knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty on counts #1, #3 and #4, withholds finding of guilt on count #2 (deferred entry of judgment), continues bond, set for sentencing hearing. Counsel has no request for PSI, Petit will probably send court a sentencing memorandum prior to sentencing date. State not asking for PSI either. State - has complied with victim notification of requirements.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
under Chapter 978
Motion hearing at 09-22-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Jennifer  Shepard in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsi via telephone from Oneida County. Attorney Greg Petit appears via telephone. Called at 10:06 AM. Petit updates Court on status of case, will not be raising the potential conflict and states potential conflict. Schiek responds, agrees and leaves up to Court if the defendant needs to put the waiver of the conflict on the record and asking Court to set matter for MH. Court swears in defendant, puts waiver of potential conflict on the record. Petit does direct exam with the defendant regarding the potential conflict - Shepard willing to waive her potential conflict and allow Attorney Schiek to be the special prosecutor in this matter. Schiek wants to make sure she is waiving any appealable issues that could result in the waiver of the potential conflict. Court addresses defendant and she understands all issues of the waiver. Court will accept the waiver of the potential conflict from the defendant. Court continues bond and sets matter for MH and motions have already been filed. Simono will bring Schiek up to date on the motions filed.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jennifer  Shepard in court with attorney Greg A Petit appears telephonically.  Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:43 AM. State - offer has been withdrawn at this time so this matter needs to be set for further proceedings and will not be a PLEAS today, State believes defense counsel has filed a motion for special prosecutor for stated reasons and State will not object to the withdrawal of him from the case and will seek special prosecutor to be appointed to the case. Court does not have a copy of the motion for special prosecutor but understands the motion as stated by State. Court has Petit state motion on the record. Petit states motion for the appointment of a special prosecutor. State has no objections to the motion for stated reasons. Court will grant the motion for the appointment of a special prosecutor, State to prepare paperwork for that. Court will set this matter for a STC on 4/28/15 at 10:00 AM, Petit to appear in person at this point and if it is just a STC, may appear telephonically as the matter may turn into a motion hearing.  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Called at 1:27 PM. Jennifer Shepard appears in person and with counsel Greg Petit. State appears by Charles Simono. Petit believes we should also be scheduled for an ARGN today also. Court has reviewed the filed motions. Petit - only arguing motion to dismiss defective complaint - not ready to address other motion mentioned by Court (motion for change of venue and motion for insufficient preliminary examination). State not ready to proceed on motion to dismiss complaint today for stated reasons. Petit responds. State responds - PH was already held. Petit responds. Court reviews motions. Petit gives court an update on the events leading up to today's motion. Court sides with State - believes motion is now mute for stated reasons and denies motion. Petit - asking for 1/2 day to hear motions for stated reasons. Court requires a courtesy copies of all motions be sent to him. Court continues bond, off record to schedule motion date. Court sets for motion hearing on 10/28/14 at 1:00 PM for remainder of day. Petit has Information, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts plea, court will also set this for PTC on 10/28/14 at 1:00 PM.

Motion hearing on May 7, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Arraignment on May 7, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Called at 4:32 PM. Jennifer Shepard appears in person and with counsel Greg Petit. State appears by Charles Simono. State calls Dr. Kristen Iniquex. Dr. Iniquez sworn in at 4:33 PM. Court has quick questions of procedure for today. Petit responds - state would need to establish with the witnesses that his client had something to do with the injuries caused to the victim. Court responds. State responds. Court was looking for a stipulation to the injuries and that they occurred. Petit will stipulate to the injuries that were proved on PH for the co-defendant. Petit stiplulates to the witness credentials. Direct exam by State at 4:35 PM. Petit stipulates to great bodily harm for purposes of today's hearings only. Cross exam by Petit at 4:49 PM. State objects - beyond scope of PH and relevancy - overruled (4:50 PM). State objects - relevance - sustained (4:57 PM). Re-direct by State at 4:59 PM. Petit objects - hypothetical - overruled (5:00 PM). Dr. Iniquex excused at 5:01 PM. Petit objects - states objections - overruled at this point and will continue with PH. Recess to allow Attorney Petit to view exhibits #1, #2, #3 and #4. State calls Detective Andrew Karcz. Karcz sworn in at 5:16 PM. Direct exam by State. Detective Karcz excused at this point to take another witness. State calls Dr. Kaufman. Kaufman sworn in at 5:21 PM. Direct exam by State. Petit stipulates to credentials of witness for today's hearing only. State offers exhibit #1, #2, #3 and #4 (all scans of the victim's brain) - received after of no objections (5:26 PM). Cross exam by Petit at 5:39 PM. Court has questions of witness. Dr Kaufman excused at 5:46 PM. Karcz re-takes stand at 5:47 PM, still under oath, direct exam by State continues. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant (6:00 PM). Petit objects - under 904.10 (statements not admissable) - sustained at this point - motions can be brought forth to be taken under consideration (6:22 PM). State asks Court to ask question. Court will allow the witness to make an offer of proof but may need briefs on the matter. Court will finish PH today but will not make a finding of probable cause until it receives briefs. State withdraws question at this point. Petit makes standing objection. Court - objection is withstanding. State marks exhibit #5 - report of witness. Petit objects under 906.12. State responds - only using it to refresh the detective's recollection. State strikes the question at this point - did not offer exhibit #5. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed by the defendant, binds over for trial, still need to accept agreement offered by Petit (agreement of parties). Petit - mark as exhibit #6 but need a copy of it. State does not need to present any more information/testimony at this point. Court will allow cross exam of witness by Petit. Petit has agreement marked as exhibit #6. Petit marks exhibit #7 - statement of Brandon Brunette. State objects - Petit re-states question (6:49 PM). Court receives exhibit #7 after no objections (6:53 PM). State objects - speculation - sustained (7:00 PM). Karcz excused at 7:01 PM. Petit makes brief argument - makes same arguments for motion to dismiss. Court again finds probable cause that a felony was committed, binds over for trial, continues bond, set for ARGN on 5/7/14 at 9:30 AM. Court receives exhibit #6. Briefs under 906.12 and 904.10 is up to counsel.
